project_abstract.cdata: The development objectives of the Bahia Health System Reform Project are to implement the national policy of health care decentralization seeking to improve access of the poor to Basic Health Care, with improved coverage and quality of those health interventions with greatest influence over child mortality, maternal mortality, and the incidence of diseases prevalent among the poor, reduce inequities in the allocation of publicly funded health care services, and, improve efficiency andquality in the use of public resources, Project components will : 1) strengthen the management, and governance of micro-regions, by enhancing the role of the micro-region as a purchaser of health care services. Technical assistance (TA) will be supported, for the deployment of performance based contracts between the micro-regions and their local providers, including TA, works, and equipment for the implementation of Regulation Centers. Furthermore, training, and TA will be provided for the adaptation of a unified health system card technology. The capacity of micro-regions will be strengthened in the conduct of clinical, environmental and financial audits, and to initiate as well, a process of accreditation, and, TA would support the preparation of Medical Waste Plans in health care facilities; 2) conduct and analyze health, demographic and social household surveys to provide a baseline for the project, and, support monitoring and evaluation requirements Likewise, policy studies will support implementation of payment systems reforms, and improvements in environmental management of medical waste.
